Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Original Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2muchfinefoodandwine
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Quattro Fontane before joining our cruise. It is a lovely hotel with very unusual decor - very quirky and interesting! Our room was located in the Annex next to the original hotel. The room was warm and clean with antique furniture and a balcony. The bathroom looked a little dated but fitted in well with the general furnishings. Breakfast was good and we found all the staff very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is located on the Lido and across the water from the centre of Venice but we had booked the Water Taxi from the airport to make life easier, then had the 72 hour pass for the water buses which also includes the local bus. The Lido has a long sandy beach which I am sure would be lovely in the summer but was the wrong time of year for us to use. Overall a very nice stay at the Quattro Fontaine.

Reviews.Title: “overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: greenbid
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights because of trip advisor rating. Was really disappointed with accommodation and attitude of staff. Our room was very poor quality. We paid for double and got a room like a monks cell. A camp bed was pushed up against the mini bar and its "headboard" was the minibar. The minibar could not then be opened(we probably wouldnt have used it anyway considering bar prices). Naturally we complained and were given a room change the following day. The staff problem was the manager. He treated guests and other staff members as inconsequential. He was so dismissive of all who should come into contact with him. Other staff members seemed very inhibited by his superior attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, overcharged.... but a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alaydaky
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. The hotel itself is beautiful. Our room was charming. Breakfast and cappucinos were delicious. Bikes are available to use. The hotel staff that we dealt with were mostly unpleasant, impatient and a few even rude. One of the older male staff complained when I attempted to read the contract they asked me to sign, saying "nobody in 40 years has ever read through this". I felt like I was greatly inconveniencing him for the entire 1 min. spent reading it. One night when my husband went to bed early, I decided to get some dessert in the outside patio area, which was beautiful. It was quite empty out there. I asked for a table so I could enjoy some dessert and a much older man exclaimed that I would have to sit at the inside bar and that I was not allowed to sit outside for a mere dessert. There were at least 20 empty tables and maybe 1 or 2 other guests outside and it was fairly late. He wanted me to go to the bar? I would have felt like I was waiting for someone to pick me up! I'm an attractive lady and I would have not felt comfortable sitting at the bar. Then, when we were checking out, the hotel completely overcharged us for just about everything. Look at your bills closely prior to paying! They overcharged our hotel room 60 EUR a night, charged 12 EUR for a cappucino and americano that should have been included in our breakfast and 53 EUR for 2 desserts + 3 bar drinks. Additional charges on top of this too. Be forewarned!

Reviews.Title: “Too far from everything and a little scruffy”
Reviews.Author: Henrykm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights based on good reviews. Firstly, to get there from Marco Polo airport get the Alilaguna RED line (Linea Rossa) and get off a the Lido (Casino) it will cost you 25 Euro each for a return ticket purchased at the airport. It takes about 1 hr. When you get off you are literally 20 m from the hotel - perfect! When I rang the hotel from the UK they told me to get the BLUE line, which stops at the Lideo (SME) - which is a good 20/25 min walk with luggage - or get a taxi. The reception staff are not friendly nor informative. When I asked for the location of a nearest supermarket, the reply was vague and not specific - poor show. The room was small, dark and cramped. The hotel grounds where unkempt and furniture was past it's best. The atmosphere felt unwelcoming and we never saw anyone in the bar. It appears everyone just used this as a base. My advise is book early and get a hotel on Venice Island - after all that's what you've come to see!

Reviews.Title: “Now For Something A Little Different....”
Reviews.Author: Abanazar
Reviews.Content: After two weeks touring the Rome, Pisa & Tuscany areas with another couple, coming to this hotel was like visiting an oasis of peace and calm in the desert maelstrom of tourist Italy. It's like other reviewers have said - charming, quirky, old-fashioned in a nice way, but well worth a visit. Every room is different, with an odd collection of furniture and artifacts. Sit in some of the public rooms and you'll think you're in a museum. Accept it with, and enjoy, all its eccentricities and you'll really love your stay. Staff were pleasantly old-fashioned, but also long-serving, helpful and courteous. We ate in the outdoor restaurant a couple of nights which was a bit expensive but saved the walk to find the all too Italian alternatives. The regular dinner menu includes duck, but don't ask for it because according to the maitre d', they never have it and have never had it - perhaps there's no demand or is that what they tell everyone. Never mind, it adds to the unusual quirkyness of the place. Shame there's no pool though. A real secret gem of a hotel - we'd be more than happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice- and the Quattro Fontane - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: WestVancouverMary
Reviews.Content: It was very very hot and Venice was baking! We would leave early in the mornings and then scurry back to the cool beautiful gardens of the hotel. Our room was superb with 2 balconies and antique furniture. The bathroom so lovely with hand painted tiles. Breakfast was unbelievable with many choices and lastly the staff were very helpful and pleasant. I am telling all our friends about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the most charming hotels Iâ€™ve ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Premier P
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most charming hotels Iâ€™ve ever stayed in, old-fashioned in all the right ways. The staff are superb, and mostly long-serving (which shows) and give you the sort of attention that you would only get in a well-run family establishment. Thereâ€™s no lift, but walking up the stairs you encounter some fascinating antiques on each floor. Bedrooms are clean and comfortable, with wooden shutters that keep out the light. Bathrooms are sparklingly clean and well-stocked. The name of the hotel comes from the four fountains in the garden, and thereâ€™s no nicer place to sit and eat breakfast or have a relaxing drink late at night. A real gem of a hotel. Premier PR team

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and charming hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Annaok
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from the Lido and stayed at this hotel for four nights with friends. This is a lovely hotel with bundles of character. Each room is uniquely decorated and the hotel is full of antiques collected over the years. The Courtyard is charming and a fantastic setting to enjoy a long and leisurely breakfast which was of good quality and plentiful. Quattro Fontane Hotel is located in a quiet and peaceful spot but just a gentle stroll away from the beach and about a 20 minute walk to the Lido waterbus which takes you in to beautiful Venice in about 10 minutes. A great spot to enjoy the relative peace and quiet of the Lido and the busy and stunningly beautiful Venice. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Most of the staff were great too. The only negatives were that the beds were narrow and quite uncomfortable and the drinks at the bar were expensive, almost twice the price of a local, more grander hotel we found in the Lido. In the twin room we had, the beds were positioned awkwardly and from one bed you couldn't see the telly due to a huge pillar in the middle of the room. That didn't bother though as there's so much to do in the Lido and Venice, very little time was spent in the room. All in all a lovely place to stay, in a great location. Would recommend if you want something a little more unique with loads of character.

Reviews.Title: “Worried about staying on Venice Lido but was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: vanaenae
Reviews.Content: We made our plans last minute so everything on Venice was either booked or very expensive. We tried this hotel and were concerned about not being on the main island but it is only a 15 min. boat ride from St Marks Square on the main vaporetto(boat bus). Tne hotel recommended that we take a taxi from the marina to the hotel ( a 20 min walk) which was definitely worth it, but it was 12 euro for a 5 min ride. Welcome to Venice! After that we either walked or took the bus. Yes, there are cars and buses on Venice Lido. The beach(lido) is a 5 min walk from the hotel and is a nice view. We didn't try the beach but have read that it is dirty - it looked ok to us. I think if we returned I would rent bikes and explore the rest of the island. Our rooms were in a seperate building from the main hotel, but just a few steps away. The rooms were a good size and clean. The decor is very old world and there is alot of eccentric artwork throughout. There are quite a few sitting rooms throughout the hotel and a large outdoor dining area for breakfast and another area outside for dinner along with a garden area where you could sit and visit or read a book and have something to drink. One morning we did exactly that, it was a nice change from all the sightseeing. The breakfast was the best we had all vacation! The cappucinos were wonderful! The woman who served breakfast was quick and extremely nice(we didn't get her name). She also served at dinner as well - not sure if she was the manager of the restaurant as it seemed she was there all of the time - extremely hard working. The food at dinner was very good and we had a charming older gentleman for our waiter. He seemed a little confused but he was so sweet. We sat under a beautiful 300 year old tree at dinner. They have bug zappers for all of the mosquitos which was welcoming since we got bit really bad when we were in Rome. One day a young woman at the front desk offered us a boat ride to Murano for 10 euro each and the next day Massimo offered us a free private boat taxi to Murano and Burano which we took. Very high pressure at the lace store in Burano, but we left and took the public transportation to Venice from there. Burano is beautiful and at Murano you could only go into one of the factories....granted it was huge, but I would have liked to have seen more factories and more of the island. Definitely buy the pass for public boat buses for the length of your stay. It was 33 euro each for 72 hours and I think it is something like 6 euro one way for under 2 hours. Venice is crowded, dirty and chaotic. Because we stayed on Lido we were able to really relax while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: Luddawon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a week's stay with my husband after reading great reviews on this site. We certainly weren't disappointed. It gave us an excellent base from which to explore the islands of Venice and it was a pleasant place to relax when we weren't out and about. The staff were wonderful and all made us feel very welcome, in particular the restaturant staff who gave a very family feel to the place. The food was very good and the surroundings are beautiful. We ate three evening meals at this hotel and they were the best meals of the holiday. A problem with our air con was fixed immediately. Our room was pretty and clean. The hotel is quite quirky and feels boutiquey. There are plenty of pretty, cosy areas to sit if you need a change from your room but don't feel like straying from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel near Lido Beach”
Reviews.Author: 3T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cute with nice atmosphere. However, the time I stayed it was packed because of the conference and I got a very small room, just okay to rest, but I did not want to hang out inside my room. The breakfast is very good, both for service and quality. The beach nearby is okay, but not great. Travel to Venice is easy but expensive, 6 Euro one way. This is a good place if you want a quiet moment from Venice. There is 24 hr free internet, more than that you have to pay. It is very expensive trip but worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent allrounder”
Reviews.Author: adeWestonSuperMare
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend stay at this hotel and its fair to say it was a great experience. Situated on the Lido a short bus ride from the port, its an excellent location to hop into venice to see all it has to offer. Basically you get more for your money and without the chaos of staying in the middle of venice itself. Breakfast was pretty good, really clean rooms and very quaint decor. Staff brilliant and very helpful for good tourist hotspots. The manager offers you a free taxi ride to murano to see the glass factory, if you do this never pay more than 50% of the orginal asking price. Then take a boat ride from murano to burano island which is absolutely stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel with excellent service and good food.”
Reviews.Author: jukka_peltonen
Reviews.Content: HotelÂ´s location is excellent, waterbuses leave very near the hotel. Hotel is pretty and also the restaurant itself is worth visiting, good food and nice garden. Breakfast was also excellent. The reception staff spoke English well, and we got good advice from them about Venice etc.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Old Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellagraced5
Reviews.Content: We have just spend four nights in this hotel. This was a delightful old style hotel. The staff were very courteous and helpful. I left a bag containing my medication and jewellery on a ferry and through their efforts I recovered the same completely intact. This is a hotel to be savoured. I was sorry for tours who just rushed through and didn't have time to have the experience of staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A charming gem in a small town setting, 100m from the beach, close to Venice”
Reviews.Author: msh1234
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel allows you to have both a beach holiday - a clear warm sea and freshly raked sand every morning, free showers and great food at the beach - and a classic Venetian holiday - combined. The beach is featured in 'Death in Venice'. We ate at the hotel each evening, and the food and service was wonderful - remember to leave room for dessert! All meals are served in the garden if you wish and the weather is good, but beware the biting, but otherwise harmless, mosquitoes. The hotel is filled with eccentric artefacts which add to its charm.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a relic from a past age and fails to deliver in the modern world”
Reviews.Author: venice19
Reviews.Content: This old hotel is an anachronism living on past glory. It is internally spotlessly clean and filled with antiques and old artifacts . The two buildings that make up the hotel are incongruous together. The main building looks like a Swiss/ German Chalet hotel that you see in the Alps. The other more modern Finnish construction is peculiar with weird staircases and shaped windows that I found very ugly. There is no elevator. The bath in our annexe bedroom was extremely narrow and worn with a very rough enamel surface. The surrounding area had worn paint work that needed a make over. A flexible shower hose was connected but it was impossible to have a stand up shower as there wasn't a shower enclosure. Although clean the premises was tired looking and the gardens were very overgrown and untidy allowing insects to thrive and bite! The menu is frightfully expensive and very limited as is the charge to use the beach. 71 Euro per day for a cabin and chairs is absolute extortion ,especially on top of the substantial charge for staying in the Quattro Fontane . We ate once in the restaurant on arrival and were served by an extremely old waiter who literally chucked the cutlery and napkins in front of us. The service took forever. Please note that the Lido's greatest asset is the shell beaches. They are a complete disgrace and very dangerous, littered with great heaps of wooden flotsum and industrial detritus swept in from the sea. Huge whole trees had been washed up and were either teathered to poles in the water or left on the water margin. I have only ever seen such a mess on one other beach in Mexico. The shoreline on the Lido is highly dangerous especially for young children. Considering the status of this island it is unacceptable that it should be kept in this condition. It is also a very big insult to tourists who have an expectation of staying somewhere lovely

Reviews.Title: “Leafy, tranquil with friendly staff and bacon and eggs for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Eugene91
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family suite and thought this hotel was great. Rooms were large and clean. The hotel staff were very friendly, spoke very good english and were professional but relaxed. There are buses every 10 minutes on the main road which take you the vaporetto stop and from there you can hop on the boat to Venice. There are no kettles in the rooms so bring your own if you want to make a cup of tea. Perhaps the best feature is the large garden where you can eat breakfast or have a drink in the shade. Breakfast includes bacon and eggs so you can fuel up. Deserves it's four stars, not the cheapest but you have to pay for quality. Also it's much better to stay on Lido than Venice; it's more spacious, greener, quieter and only 15mins away on the vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and lovely”
Reviews.Author: cawsiecaws
Reviews.Content: firstly i have to say that, the holiday in lido was one of my best summer holidays. if you are looking for a peaceful and quiet time to relax lido could be a choice. albergo quattro fontane is a really cute and beautiful hotel. i loved the atmosfair, food and room. breakfast in garden was really nice and all staff were really friendly. another good thing is many of them could speak english well so we didnt have any problem in communication. plus we got some tip on how to travel around and renting cabana.(there were really nice beach cabanas:) ) also hotel has boats to near islands like murano-burano. that hotel would be a great choice for lovers, married couples, families with children. but im not sure for families with a teenager. teens may get bored. to sum up if you want to have a relaxing and romantic beach holiday in a great island near a perfect historical place like venice albergo quattro fontane could be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Charm”
Reviews.Author: Almea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a tour group and was my favourite hotel of the tour. The ambience is truly old school charm with vintage decor throughout the hotel (note: no lifts). As I was travelling alone I stayed in a single room which was adequately spacious, complete with a balcony overlooking the gardens. Service was personal and warm; staff are extremely accommodating eventhough we were part of a tour group. There is wifi throughout the hotel for a competitive fee and I would recommend spending some time in the lovely recreation/library with a cup of tea (which is served on a lovely tray with complimentary cookies!). The hotel is an easy walk to the pier from which you can catch a vaporetto to Venice. Alternatively there is a bus (C) which stops somewhat close by. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with a family when visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: Bold40
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for visiting Venice with children. The rooms were very good (we stayed in adjoining rooms on the top floor) and the service excellent with very friendly and helpful staff. The Water Bus to St marks square is only 50m away and provides a fabntastic view of Venice - the route is a bit of a 'branch line' so never busy (Beeching would have axed it years ago!). We were able to visit Venice by day and retreat to the Lido in the mid afternoon to spend some time on the beach (a very short walk from the hotel). Go on the hotel arranged trip to the glass factory - it is the cheapest way to get the kids a ride on a water taxi at speed! The only down side is that the restaurant is very expensive (even though very good). better to walk into the centre of the Lido and eat at one of the restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and charming”
Reviews.Author: ACW_Oslo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location and the tennis court, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very charming, has a lovely garden and the interior is one of the nicest I've ever experienced. Lots of old artifacts and art everywhere. Our room was very big and was also decorated with lovely old furniture and pictures. It was also exceedingly clean. The hotel lies in quiet surroundings and is very close to the beach. The season was over when we stayed there, but we still enjoyed some hours of sun bathing and had the beach entirely to ourselves. We spent half the day on the beach and the rest of the afternoon/evening in Venice. There is a ten minute walk to the ferry from the hotel. We never had to wait more that five minutes for the ferry to San Marco. The clay tennis court was excellent and we had it almost entirely to ourselves. If you would like to combine a city break with beach life/tennis, this is really the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cawsie
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel with my mum for our summer holiday. it was such a nice experience. the room was nice and clean. staff were helpfull and kind. everything was just perfect. the breakfast was ok. the hotel is near the beach it was only 5min on foot. if you just want to relax 4 fontane is the place for it.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: alishine
Reviews.Content: I recently had a wonderful visit to the Quattro Fontane Hotel on Lido. The hotel was beautiful, with incredible artwork throughout. The staff were courteous and helpful, always ready to answer questions. The breakfast was lovely every day, and the food in the restaurant was quite good. The only negative was that you could often hear people in adjoining rooms or in the hallway. Some things to keep in mind, since the hotel is on Lido you must take the vaporetto (water bus) to reach the major tourist destinations, and it can end up being quite costly (â‚¬ 6,50 each way). Additionally, if you have the hotel arrange a water taxi, they will require cash payment upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “magic find”
Reviews.Author: lukelakes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure magic and is a great find to all seeking a holiday in Venice. Situated only a short walk from the water bus station and from there only a short crossing to the main Island. This is an ideal place if you like great food, fantastic service from all and relaxation after a long day out in the city. Pre-book a private water taxi transfer -by far the best way to start and finish your holiday. Also note: heliairvenice.com provides great helicopter tours of the lagoon from 110 euros to 330 euros. Make sure you book a deluxe room. Get a hellovenice card! this allows for unlimited use of the water bus with out any hassle throughout your stay. Pre-book a private gondola ride with seranade (best after 8pm). Book this via VIATOR. Go to caffe Florian, two cocktails in 2008 cost 44 euros -well worth it. Book the theatre and/or the opera. Relax and have a magical holiday!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the city but noisy and not very warm”
Reviews.Author: pauldeparis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty clean, and the location was good. Located on Lido island, it was 15 minutes away from San Marco by boat (1 boat per hour in the morning and afternoon, the boat stop being 3 mn away from the hotel). In the afternoon, we could have a swim in the sea nearby. Unfortunaltly, the room was pretty noisy (avoid first floor) and staff people were not very friendly and helpfull. Last thing, the breakfast buffet was great indeed.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: LEAFLET
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days at this lovely hotel. The restaurant staff were very friendly. The room was very clean and all public rooms also, beds turned down in evening and clean towels twice daily. On the down side just be aware the bicycle hire from the hotel[ancient] 10 euros each per day. Check days charged for??????? No tea and coffee facillies in room.
